billEvents.eventText: referred to consumer affairs and protection

title: Authorizes the NYS consumer protection board to establish a bike theft prevention awareness and education program
summary: Authorizes the NYS Consumer Protection Board to establish a bike theft prevention awareness and education program; provides that the director shall produce & distribute educational materials and must be made available to law enforcement authorities; provides that the board shall issue report by next April 1 and shall periodically review available data on bike theft and municipal efforts to reduce such.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          67

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  HEVESI,  HOYT, BENEDETTO, JAFFEE, M. MILLER,
         ABBATE, CYMBROWITZ, CASTRO, BOYLAND,  GABRYSZAK,  DESTITO,  MAISEL  --
         Multi-Sponsored  by -- M. of A.  CUSICK, GLICK, HIKIND, MARKEY, MAYER-
         SOHN, MENG, ROBINSON -- read once and referred  to  the  Committee  on
         Consumer Affairs and Protection

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  executive  law and the general business law, in
         relation to the  bicycle  theft  prevention  awareness  and  education
         program

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 3 of  section  553  of  the  executive  law  is
    2  amended by adding a new paragraph l to read as follows:
    3    1.  ESTABLISH  A  BICYCLE  THEFT  PREVENTION  AWARENESS  AND EDUCATION
    4  PROGRAM PURSUANT TO SECTION THREE HUNDRED NINETY-ONE-CC OF  THE  GENERAL
    5  BUSINESS LAW.
    6    S  2. The general business law is amended by adding a new section 391-
    7  cc to read as follows:
    8    S 391-CC. BICYCLE THEFT PREVENTION AWARENESS AND EDUCATION PROGRAM. 1.
    9  THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE STATE CONSUMER PROTECTION BOARD, ON BEHALF
   10  OF THE STATE CONSUMER PROTECTION BOARD, HEREAFTER REFERRED  TO  IN  THIS
   11  SECTION  AS  THE  "BOARD," AND IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE DIVISION OF STATE
   12  POLICE AND IN CONSULTATION WITH THE NEW YORK CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT  AND
   13  NEW  YORK CITY DEPARTMENT OF CONSUMER AFFAIRS, SHALL DEVELOP, IMPLEMENT,
   14  AND MAINTAIN AN ONGOING PUBLIC AWARENESS AND EDUCATION PROGRAM TO INFORM
   15  THE GENERAL PUBLIC OF SYSTEMS AND METHODS DESIGNED  TO  PREVENT  BICYCLE
   16  THEFT,  INCLUDING,  BUT  NOT  LIMITED TO, PROPER METHODS FOR PARKING AND
   17  LOCKING BICYCLES, THE BENEFITS OF BICYCLE REGISTRATION, AND  THE  PROPER
   18  PROCEDURE FOR REPORTING BICYCLE THEFT.
   19    2.  THE  EXECUTIVE  DIRECTOR  SHALL PRODUCE AND DISTRIBUTE EDUCATIONAL
   20  MATERIALS RELATED TO BICYCLE  THEFT  PREVENTION.  SUCH  MATERIALS  SHALL

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01564-01-1

       A. 67                               2

    1  INCLUDE REFERENCE TO BICYCLE REGISTRATION PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY MUNI-
    2  CIPALITIES AND OTHER APPROPRIATE ENTITIES. SUCH MATERIALS  SHALL BE MADE
    3  AVAILABLE,  UPON  REQUEST, TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES, EDUCATION INSTI-
    4  TUTIONS,  COMMUNITY  GROUPS,  AND MUNICIPALITIES. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
    5  SHALL ALSO POST OR CAUSE TO BE POSTED THE CONTENTS OF  SUCH  EDUCATIONAL
    6  MATERIALS ON THE BOARD'S INTERNET WEBSITE.
    7    3. THE BOARD SHALL PERIODICALLY REVIEW AVAILABLE DATA ON BICYCLE THEFT
    8  AND  UPDATE  THE  INFORMATION  ON  BICYCLE  THEFT  PREVENTION  AWARENESS
    9  PROVIDED  IN ITS EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND ON ITS INTERNET  WEBSITE,  AS
   10  APPROPRIATE.
   11    4.  THE  BOARD  SHALL ISSUE A WRITTEN REPORT, ON OR BEFORE APRIL FIRST
   12  NEXT SUCCEEDING THE DATE ON WHICH THIS SECTION SHALL HAVE BECOME  A  LAW
   13  TO  THE  GOVERNOR, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER
   14  OF THE ASSEMBLY ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS SECTION AND ANY  RECOMMEN-
   15  DATIONS FOR FURTHERING THE PURPOSE OF THIS SECTION.
   16    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law and the general business law, in relation to the bicycle theft prevention awareness and education program
